h1.span: New Bingo Boards for PreK-5th Graders

div.p: Hello to all of the elementary students. Ms. Hotz, Mrs. Mavencamp and Mr. Garber are hoping you are enjoying working on creating a blackout for the boards. We have two more boards available for you to work on also. Stay busy and have fun with them.
Art Step by Step Drawings
Video on How to make the Guitar

div.p: Centerville School Library Information
ebooks MidAmerica - Free
World Book Digital Resources - Free
Accelerated Reader Access- AR Testing
Library Catalog- Library Books Available
Free Online E-books- Junior Library Guild

ul.li: The Centerville School Library will offer books to check out for students who do not have access to digital books.

To check out a book, please visit the Library link on our school webpage, centerville.k12.mt.us, to access the catalog to see what books are available for check out. Contact Ms. Darko through email: connied@centerville.k12.mt.us and let me know what books you would like.

Darko will check in at the school daily if needed and will leave the book(s) you want at the office for pick-up. Please call the office before you plan a visit to the school to pick up any books and the office personnel will schedule a time.

div.p: Remember: If you have a Great Falls Public Library card, you can check out books online through the Public Library Website. You will need your library card number in order to check out. If you do not have a Great Falls Public Library card, you may call the Great Falls Public Library to see if you can come in to fill out an application. You will need a drivers license if you are 18 or older, or an adult if you are under 18 years of age. Phone: 406-453-0349 or email: questions@greatfallslibrary.org
10 places to find online books for free:
If you have any further questions, you can contact me through email.
Ms. Darko

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Centerville School Library Information

div.span: Located on the outskirts of Great Fallsare the small towns of Sand Coulee, Tracy, Centerville and Stockett which makeup the population of our school. It may be a rural school, but we have a city mentality towards education. The current school week consists of four days with school starting at 8:00 and ending at 4:05.

span.em: Where we achieve our best by being:

p.strong: Spring School Photos - This is the message I received the other day:

div.strong: We have all the packages going to the Billings office instead of the schools. Then we call the school to make sure someone is available to receivethem. If they are, we ship that day. This was the process up untilthe "Shelter in Place."

Now that there is a "Shelter in Place" order, we have had all packets be placed on hold from the lab. So, although some are in transport, right now most are being held at the photo lab until the restrictions are lifted. Unfortunately.

a.title: Go to comments for Spring School Photos
Go to comments for Support for a Cause

em.strong: "Governor Bullock directed Montana's public K-12 schools to close starting tomorrow, March 16 until March 27. During this time, schools will engage in planning to provide arrangements to provide free meals to students who need them, pursuant to a waiver obtained from the United States Department of Agriculture, and to provide for all other matters and services that students need in the event of future or ongoing closure. Schools will continue to receive all state funding during this two-week closure."

a.title: Go to comments for Centerville School Closed for Two Weeks

p.strong: GRAB & GO FOOD DROP OFF TIMES

p.span: The Centerville School will be providing a Grab and Go breakfast and lunch to all students during our two week on-line class period. Those families interested in receiving these meals must call or email the district office. The food service program will build these sack meals and deliver food packages to parents or students at designated locations.

Please call the office by 9 a.m. and leave your name, email or phone number so we can provide you with information on the location and pick up times so you can receive your meals. Parents must request meals so we can make plans to provide enough meals to those who are interested.
If you have any questions or concerns please contact the main office.

div.p: There are no upcoming events to display.

section.p: The Centerville School website is designed to provide equal access information to all members of the Centerville Community. Contact the Superintendent at (406)736-5123 regarding questions about the functionality of the website or content on the website that is inaccessible. Information on filing a formal grievance with the District pursuant to the requirements of Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act 1990 can be found by clicking Link to Policies under the Board Trustees tab on the home page. Policy 1700-Uniform Complaint Procedure describes the grievance procedure process. This information may also be obtained by contacting the Superintendent at (406)736-5123.
